summary: This document is an email chain from February 2020 between UK attorney Jill Greenfield, her colleagues, and US law enforcement regarding scheduling a call and interview for Greenfield's client, a victim of sexual assault in the UK, in connection with the Epstein investigation. It reveals coordination between UK legal counsel and a US FBI/NYPD task force.

persons.name: Jill Greenfield
persons.context: UK attorney representing a client who is a victim of sexual assault in the UK, coordinating with US law enforcement for a potential interview in London regarding the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Louise Scott
persons.context: Colleague of Jill Greenfield, involved in scheduling a conference call regarding the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Kyle Phillips
persons.context: Colleague of Jill Greenfield, copied on emails regarding the Epstein investigation call scheduling.

persons.name: Allyson
persons.context: CC'd as a member of the US investigation team (likely a prosecutor or agent) in an email from a detective.

connections.description: Work together at Fieldfisher law firm, coordinating on scheduling a call related to the Epstein investigation.
Work together at Fieldfisher law firm; Greenfield copies Phillips on investigation-related emails.
Greenfield's client is the subject of interest for the US investigation team of which Allyson is a member.

events.title: Scheduled conference call on Epstein investigation
events.description: A conference call was scheduled for 4:30 PM (timezone implied as UK) between UK legal team and US investigators to discuss parameters for interviewing Greenfield's client.

events.title: Initial contact regarding client interview
events.description: Jill Greenfield emailed a US detective to initiate contact regarding her client, a victim of sexual assault in the UK, and the possibility of an interview in London as part of the Epstein investigation.

locations: Riverbank House, 2 Swan Lane, London EC4R 3TT (Fieldfisher office)
keyFacts: Jill Greenfield's client is a victim of sexual assault that occurred in the UK and is entitled to automatic anonymity under UK statute, which she does not waive.
The communication is between a UK law firm and a joint NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force regarding the Epstein investigation.
The purpose is to schedule an interview in London with Greenfield's client and to establish the parameters of the US investigation's interest in her.
The emails indicate technical issues with government servers potentially delaying communication earlier in the week.
The document shows active investigation coordination between US and UK parties in early 2020, after Epstein's death.
